intro: Hymenoxys acaulis var. caespitosa, commonly known as the clustered hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that forms dense, low-growing clumps of foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
